author: Dr. James Chen (ED)
note_text:
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
78 y/o male with hx of COPD, HTN. Presents with 3 days of productive cough and fever. Wife states he has been confused today. 

ED COURSE:
Patient arrived hypoxic (88%). Placed on 2L O2, titrated to 4L to maintain sats >92%. 
CXR reveals RLL consolidation.
Lactate elevated at 3.1. Sepsis bolus initiated (30cc/kg).
Given Rocephin and Azithromycin IV.

MEDICAL DECISION MAKING:
Patient with Sepsis 2/2 Community Acquired Pneumonia. 
Risk Logic:
1. CURB-65 Score of 3 (Confusion, Urea>7, Age>65). Mortality risk 14%. 
2. Failure of outpatient management (patient took oral Amox for 2 days with no improvement).
3. Hypoxia requiring supplemental oxygen (4L).

PLAN:
Admit to Medicine (Inpatient).
Cont IV Abx and Fluids.
Monitor for decompensation.
